## Service Mesh Patterns

### Load Balancing Strategies

```prolog
:- declare_service(transform/2, [
    instances([
        'http://worker1:8080',
        'http://worker2:8080',
        'http://worker3:8080'
    ]),
    strategy(round_robin)  % or: random, least_connections
]).
```

### Circuit Breakers

```prolog
:- declare_circuit_breaker(remote_api/2, [
    threshold(5),           % failures before open
    timeout(30),            % seconds before half-open
    fallback(local_cache/2) % use when open
]).
```

### Health Checks

```prolog
:- health_check(service_name, [
    endpoint('/health'),
    interval(10),
    timeout(5)
]).
```

## Polyglot Distributed Systems

### Cross-Language Communication

Different services can use different languages:

```
Go (parser) → Python (ML) → Rust (aggregator) → Go (API)
```

### Sharding (Phases 4-6)

```prolog
:- declare_sharding(large_dataset/2, [
    shard_key(id),
    shard_count(4),
    strategy(hash_mod)
]).
```

### Protocol Negotiation

```prolog
% Automatic format selection
:- declare_connection(go_service, python_service, [
    negotiate_format([json, msgpack, protobuf])
]).
```

Services negotiate the most efficient format both support.

## Service Discovery & Tracing

### Service Discovery (Phase 7)

```prolog
:- declare_discovery(ml_service, [
    backend(consul),
    service_name('ml-predictor'),
    tags([ml, gpu])
]).
```

**Backends:** Consul, etcd, DNS

### Distributed Tracing (Phase 8)

```prolog
:- declare_tracing([
    backend(jaeger),
    propagation(w3c),  % or: b3
    sample_rate(0.1)
]).
```

**Propagation:** W3C Trace Context, B3 (Zipkin)

### Trace Correlation

All generated code includes trace ID propagation:

```go
ctx = context.WithValue(ctx, "trace_id", traceID)
```

## Knowledge Graph Topology

### Multi-Interface Nodes

One expert system can serve multiple semantic domains:

```prolog
service(csv_expert_node, [
    discovery_metadata([
        semantic_centroid("base64_vector..."),
        interface_topics([csv, delimited, tabular])
    ]),
    routing(kleinberg([
        alpha(2.0),
        max_hops(10),
        path_folding(true)
    ]))
]).
```

### Kleinberg Small-World Routing

| Concept | Application |
|---------|-------------|
| Node location | Interface centroid in embedding space |
| Greedy routing | Forward to most similar centroid |
| Path folding | Dynamic shortcuts after matches |
| HTL | Maximum hops before giving up |
